result.execSummary:
The defendant Fidel Robles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

AS OF 3/03/16: Court amends to add 1 day credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to Buy money, Court costs and DNA surcharge - PAID IN FULL.
Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.  Buy Money is payable to City of Waukesha Police Department.

Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Fidel  Robles in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Sue Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #7:
IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

4 YEARS and 4 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (Defendant taken into custody sentence to begin forthwith)
  -  1 YEAR 4 MONTHS YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Any term deemed appropriate by agent.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Perform 100 Hours Community Service.

RESTITUTION:  $1500.00 (BUY MONEY PAYABLE TO WAUKESHA POLICE DEPARTMENT DRUG UNIT, (APPLY CASH BAIL);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (Apply Cash Bail);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (Apply Cash Bail, balance to be refunded to the poster);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Court finds defendant guilty.   Counts #1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 are dismissed and read in. The Court orders a PSI be prepared and filed with the court within 45 days.  The Court sets the matter for sentencing.  Bail remains as filled.

Defendant Fidel Robles in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion to dismiss and motion to compel discovery. Defense presents statements as to recordings. Defense addresses confidential informant/incamera inspection. State presents statements. Detective Koeppel sworn and testified. State and Defense rest. Counsels present arguments on equipment/consent. Court denies the motion to dismiss. Second issue - unredacted copies of recordings addressed.   Court wants authority on completeness arguments. Court will conduct an incamera review of the videos. ID of informant addressed - needs to be articulated.  Submission to be filed by next Friday by Defense. Submission by State to be filed on Friday. Video #3 to be submitted by next Friday - 06/05/2015. Court will issue a written order.  Court will adjourn the trial. If parties need additional time they may make a request to the court.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
